events.originalText: Taliban militants carried out a mass shooting at the Kabul Serena Hotel in Afghanistan, killing nine civilians.
events.subtitle: Taliban
events.headline: Taliban militants kill nine civilians in mass shooting at Kabul Serena Hotel

events.originalText: The Troubles: Two children were killed by the second of two bomb attacks by the Provisional Irish Republican Army in Warrington, England.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Two children killed in bomb attacks by Provisional Irish Republican Army in Warrington

events.originalText: The antiretroviral drug zidovudine became the first treatment approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for HIV/AIDS.
events.subtitle: Antiviral drug
events.headline: Zidovudine approved as first HIV/AIDS treatment by US FDA

events.originalText: World War II: After being forced to flee the Philippines for Australia, US Army general Douglas MacArthur (pictured) announced: "I came through and I shall return."
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: US Army general Douglas MacArthur vows to return after fleeing Philippines

events.originalText: Germany issued an ultimatum to Lithuania, demanding the return of the Klaipėda Region under threat of invasion.
events.subtitle: 1939 German ultimatum to Lithuania
events.headline: Germany issues ultimatum to Lithuania over Klaipėda Region

events.originalText: The Arts Club of Chicago hosted the opening of Pablo Picasso's first solo United States showing, entitled Original Drawings by Pablo Picasso.
events.subtitle: Arts Club of Chicago
events.headline: Pablo Picasso's first solo US showing opens at Arts Club of Chicago

events.originalText: The United States Navy commissioned its first aircraft carrier, USS Langley.
events.subtitle: United States Navy
events.headline: US Navy commissions first aircraft carrier, USS Langley

events.originalText: Eleven countries signed the Paris Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property, one of the first intellectual-property treaties.
events.subtitle: Paris Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property
events.headline: Paris Convention for Industrial Property signed by eleven countries

events.originalText: The Republican Party was founded in Ripon, Wisconsin, by politicians opposing the Kansas–Nebraska Act and the expansion of slavery in the United States.
events.subtitle: Republican Party (United States)
events.headline: Republican Party founded in Ripon, Wisconsin to oppose slavery expansion

events.originalText: Harriet Beecher Stowe's novel Uncle Tom's Cabin, which had a profound effect on attitudes toward African Americans and slavery in the United States, was published.
events.subtitle: Harriet Beecher Stowe
events.headline: Uncle Tom's Cabin published, impacting views on African Americans and slavery
